trans-unit.source: <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlCredential"></xref> provides a more secure way to specify the password for a login attempt using SQL Server Authentication.
<xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlCredential"></xref> is comprised of a user id and a password that will be used for SQL Server Authentication.
The password in a <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlCredential"></xref> object is of type <xref href="System.Security.SecureString"></xref>.
<xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlCredential"></xref> cannot be inherited.
Windows Authentication (`Integrated Security = true`) remains the most secure way to log in to a SQL Server database.
Use <xref:System.Data.SqlClient.SqlConnection.Credential%2A> to get or set a connection's <xref:System.Data.SqlClient.SqlCredential> object.
Use <xref:System.Data.SqlClient.SqlConnection.ChangePassword%2A> to change the password for a <xref:System.Data.SqlClient.SqlCredential> object.

For information on how a <xref:System.Data.SqlClient.SqlCredential> object affects connection pool behavior, see [SQL Server Connection Pooling (ADO.NET)](~/docs/framework/data/adonet/sql-server-connection-pooling.md).

An <xref:System.InvalidOperationException> exception will be raised if a non-null <xref:System.Data.SqlClient.SqlCredential> object is used in a connection with any of the following connection string keywords:
The following sample connects to a [!INCLUDE[ssNoVersion](~/includes/ssnoversion-md.md)] database using <xref:System.Data.SqlClient.SqlConnection.Credential%2A>:
Creates an object of type <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlCredential"></xref>.
The constructor does not accept null parameters.
A <xref:System.String.Empty> value is allowed.
An attempt to pass a null parameter in the constructor will raise an <xref:System.ArgumentNullException> exception.
The password; a <xref href="System.Security.SecureString"></xref> value marked as read-only.
Passing a read/write <xref href="System.Security.SecureString"></xref> parameter will raise an <xref href="System.ArgumentException"></xref>.
Returns the password component of the <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlCredential"></xref> object.
Returns the password component of the <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlCredential"></xref> object.
Returns the user ID component of the <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlCredential"></xref> object.
Returns the user ID component of the <xref href="System.Data.SqlClient.SqlCredential"></xref> object..
